required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AYA STEPS RCT: AYA Self-Management Via Texting, Education & Plans for Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: AYA STEPS RCT: AYA Self-Management Via Texting, Education & Plans for Survivors

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock:
The proposed project will leverage two programs of research at UPenn and CHOP that are delivering technology-based interventions to adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer survivors.
In the proposed study, all AYA survivors will receive a care plan via a tool (Smart-ALACC). They will then be randomized to receive (or not) a mobile health application (AYA STEPS) that will provide tailored messages to enhance uptake of their care plan.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Completed mobile data and questionnaires

clinical_study.condition: Adolescent and Young Adult (AYA) Cancer Survivors

study_pop.textblock: 15-29 year olds with a history of malignant cancer diagnosis.

overall_official.affiliation: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

facility.name: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania
